statements: Policing should aim to keep communities safe while protecting civil rights by prioritizing evidence-based, proportional responses and clear constitutional standards for stops, searches, and use of force. Many people want both effective crime reduction and fair, respectful treatment, so agencies should combine training and support for de-escalation with strong accountability—transparent data, independent oversight, and meaningful consequences for misconduct. Partnering with communities, expanding co-responder and diversion programs for behavioral health crises, and focusing resources on serious violence can improve trust and outcomes without sacrificing safety.
